meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unproductive or barren.
meanings.sent1: The unfruitfulnesses of the desert made it difficult to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: The unfruitfulnesses of his efforts left him feeling discouraged.
meanings.sent3: The unfruitfulnesses of the garden was a mystery until they discovered the soil was depleted.
meanings.sent4: The unfruitfulnesses of the project echoed through the empty halls of the office.
meanings.sent5: The unfruitfulnesses of the land were evident in the dry, cracked earth.

meanings.sent1: Despite his hard work, he couldn't escape the unfruitfulnesses of his endeavors.
meanings.sent2: The unfruitfulnesses of her attempts only fueled her determination to try again.
meanings.sent3: The unfruitfulnesses of the race were comically attributed to the tortoise taking a nap.
meanings.sent4: The unfruitfulnesses of his career haunted him like a shadow.
meanings.sent5: The unfruitfulnesses of the mission weighed heavily on their spirits.

meanings.sent1: The unfruitfulnesses of the experiment led to a reevaluation of the hypothesis.
meanings.sent2: She was disappointed by the unfruitfulnesses of her search for the missing keys.
meanings.sent3: The unfruitfulnesses of the fishing trip turned into a funny story about the one that got away.
meanings.sent4: The unfruitfulnesses of their collaboration cast a shadow over their partnership.
meanings.sent5: The unfruitfulnesses of the negotiation were evident in the lack of agreement.
